intro: Arthrosolen polycephalus, commonly known as the many-headed rock liverwort, is a species of liverwort belonging to the family Porellaceae. It is a small, terrestrial plant that typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as rocky crevices and forest floors. The plant is characterized by its dense, cushion-like growth form and its ability to thrive in nutrient-poor substrates. Its leaves are closely arranged and often have a distinctive, flattened appearance. Arthrosolen polycephalus plays a role in soil stabilization and provides habitat for microorganisms in its ecosystem.
